message: I couldn't really tell from the front page though. Are there any examples you can point to of comments showing up as top level things?

I'm actually quite open the the community self generating and moderating themselves. Sure I will be there for spam intervention, but I will play it by ear. I don't want to dominate the whole freedom of speech that I think will make it great.
all php/mysql js. The usual suspects I know and trust.
too much media is shaped these days
it will be a slow process I beleive, but that's ok with me.

Righ, so lets say there is some nice global event. Because there is no "master post" everything is essentially a comment. But you can post images, youtube, vimeo into the comments essentially making a blow by blow updatings system.
The design differentiates you pretty thoroughly, I admit
oohh- I like it
Right now, the front page looks more like a news aggregator- do you have any ideas/plans for encouraging original reporting?
http://teztify.com - Social News & Discussion. Report & discuss news that matters to you, in your own words. Include some media to create rolling updates of events.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1JSBhI_0at0 ?
Although it's an "s" not a "z" +1 for awesomeness! I love rage :)
You know what. That video sums up my "goal". If people can report their own news, it would be full of grit and truth.
huh

Still working on a video for that. But seeing as there is a type of "vote" built in that will filter the news creating the most stirt, it does indeed look like a aggregator. But thats what I wanted. It's simple that way and caters to all types of posting.

On a related note, what happens if you wind up not liking the community of the site? What if, say, the people using it turn it into a tabloid? Do you plan on beating them down with sensible defaults and behavioral incentives, or pivoting to make the most of it?
fair enough. Do you have a plan beat the big boy in this space (reddit)?
just for my own nerdy self satisfaction, what is it built with?
what do you mean by rolling media updates?
actually yes. The rolling media updates I hope will shift the perspective of the threads to be more involved, more participation and reporting rather than chit chat.
So say you film a smoking volcano and post it, then someone takes more video of it exploding and posts it, the its continually updating the "report"
I gotta go for a bit. feel free to continue any questiosn...i'll be back later ^_^
actually all of them, from the front page you cant really tell, hence the video being made to explain it :) but yes once a link is clicked its just a title and then list of discussion/comments
this kind of reminds me of talkingvillage.com
